question_text: A 40-year-old woman is evaluated for a droopy eyelid, as shown.
question_stem: Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
critique: This patient's physical examination demonstrates right ptosis and miosis and is most consistent with Horner syndrome (oculosympathetic paresis) (Option B). Horner syndrome is defined by miosis, ptosis, and anhidrosis and results from a lesion in the cervical sympathetic chain. Causes include hypothalamic or brainstem lesions; apical lung tumors; superior cervical ganglion injury; and internal carotid artery dissection, aneurysm, or trauma.
